title: CCL19-armed recombinant influenza virus inhibited colorectal cancer growth by remodeling tumor microenvironment.
abstract: The "cold" tumor microenvironment (TME) impaired colorectal cancer (CRC) immunotherapy efficacy, while oncolytic viruses (OVs) could "heat" TME and stimulate anti-tumor immunity. Here, it rescued
